intro: Thlaspi vogesiacum, commonly known as the Voges pennycress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands, roadsides, and waste areas. It produces small, yellow flowers that are arranged in clusters, and its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided. The seeds are enclosed in a siliqua, a type of dry fruit characteristic of the Brassicaceae family.
